com.articulate.sigma

Class StringUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.articulate.sigma.StringUtil

  • public class StringUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class that defines static methods for common string manipulation operations.

    • Method Detail

      • setCharset

        public static void setCharset(java.lang.String charEncoding)
        Sets the default value of CHARSET to charEncoding. charEncoding should be a String denoting a valid W3C character encoding scheme, such as "UTF-8".
        Parameters:
        charEncoding - A String denoting a character encoding scheme

      • getCharset

        public static java.lang.String getCharset()
        Returns a String denoting a character encoding scheme. The default value is "UTF-8".
        Returns:
        String

      • encode

        public static java.lang.String encode(java.lang.String input)
        Returns a URL encoded String obtained from input, which is assumed to be a String composed of characters in the default charset. In most cases, the charset will be UTF-8.
        Parameters:
        input - A String which has not yet been URL encoded
        Returns:
        A URL encoded String

      • decode

        public static java.lang.String decode(java.lang.String input)
        Returns a URL decoded String obtained from input, which is assumed to be a URL encoded String composed of characters in the default charset. In most cases, the charset will be UTF-8.
        Parameters:
        input - A URL encoded String
        Returns:
        A String that has been URL decoded

      • getW3cNamespaceDelimiter

        public static java.lang.String getW3cNamespaceDelimiter()
        Returns the string preferred by W3C to separate a namespace prefix from the term it qualifies.

      • setW3cNamespaceDelimiter

        public static java.lang.String setW3cNamespaceDelimiter(java.lang.String str)
        Sets to str the String token preferred by W3C to separate a namespace prefix from the term it qualifies.

      • getSafeNamespaceDelimiter

        public static java.lang.String getSafeNamespaceDelimiter()
        Returns a "safe" alphanumeric ASCII string that can be substituted for the W3C or SUO-KIF string delimiting a namespace prefix from an unqualified term name. The safe delimiter is used to produce input formulae or files that can be loaded by Vampire and other provers unable to handle term names containing non-alphanumeric characters.

      • setSafeNamespaceDelimiter

        public static java.lang.String setSafeNamespaceDelimiter(java.lang.String str)
        Sets to str the "safe" alphanumeric ASCII String value that can be substituted for the W3C or SUO-KIF string delimiting a namespace prefix from an unqualified term name. The safe delimiter is used to produce input formulae or files that can be loaded by Vampire and other provers unable to handle term names containing non-alphanumeric characters.

      • toBase64

        public static java.lang.String toBase64(java.lang.String input,
                                        java.lang.String charset)
        Given an input String encoded in charset, returns a String representing the base-64 encoding of the input.
        Parameters:
        input - A String
        charset - A String constant denoting a Charset
        Returns:
        a base-64 String

      • fromBase64

        public static java.lang.String fromBase64(java.lang.String input,
                                          java.lang.String charset)
        Given an input String encoded in base-64, decodes the String and returns the original form of input in charset.
        Parameters:
        input - A base-64 String
        charset - A String constant denoting a Charset, such at UTF-8
        Returns:
        a String decoded from base-64 to its original form in charset

      • encrypt

        public static java.lang.String encrypt(java.lang.String input,
                                       java.lang.String charset)
        Converts input, which is assumed to belong to charset, to a base 64 representation, and then encrypts the result using the SHA algorithm.
        Parameters:
        input - A String in charset
        charset - A String constant denoting a Charset, such at UTF-8
        Returns:
        a String that has been converted to base 64 encoding and then encrypted via SHA

      • getDateTime

        public static java.lang.String getDateTime(java.lang.String pattern)
        Returns a date/time string corresponding to pattern. The date/time returned is the date/time of the method call. The locale is UTC (Greenwich).
        Parameters:
        pattern - Examples: yyyy, yyyy-MM-dd.

      • replaceDateTime

        public static java.lang.String replaceDateTime(java.lang.String input)
        If the input String contains the sequence {date}pattern{date}, replaces the first occurrence of this sequence with a UTC date/time string formatted according to pattern. If the input String does not contain the sequence, it is returned unaltered.
        Parameters:
        input - The input String into which a formatted date/time will be inserted
        Returns:
        String

      • treeReplace

        public static java.lang.String treeReplace(java.lang.String oldPattern,
                                           java.lang.String newTerm,
                                           java.lang.String tree)
        Performs a depth-first search of tree, replacing all terms matching oldPattern with newTerm.
        Parameters:
        oldPattern - A regular expression pattern to be matched against terms in tree
        newTerm - A String to replace terms matching oldPattern
        tree - A String representing a SUO-KIF Formula (list)
        Returns:
        A new tree (String), with all occurrences of terms matching oldPattern replaced by newTerm

      • kifListToArrayList

        public static java.util.ArrayList kifListToArrayList(java.lang.String kifListAsString)
        Returns a new ArrayList formed by extracting in order the top-level members of kifListAsString, which is assumed to be the String representation of a SUO-KIF (LISP) list.
        Parameters:
        kifListAsString - A SUO-KIF list represented as a String
        Returns:
        ArrayList

      • replaceUnsafeNamespaceDelimiters

        public static java.lang.String replaceUnsafeNamespaceDelimiters(java.lang.String input)
        Replaces non-alphanumeric namespace delimiters in input with an alphanumeric form that can be handled by Vampire and other provers.
        Parameters:
        input - The String representation of a SUO-KIF Formula or other expression
        Returns:
        String The input string with unsafe namespace delimiters replaced by a safe alphanumeric form

      • safeToKifNamespaceDelimiters

        public static java.lang.String safeToKifNamespaceDelimiters(java.lang.String input)
        Replaces all occurrences of the "safe" namespace delimiter in input with the default KIF namespace delimiter, which might contain characters that are not acceptable to some provers.
        Parameters:
        input - The String representation of a SUO-KIF Formula or other expression, such as a TPTP Formula
        Returns:
        String The input string with occurrences of the safe namespace delimiters replaced by the default KIF namespace delimiter

      • toSafeNamespaceDelimiter

        public static java.lang.String toSafeNamespaceDelimiter(java.lang.String term)
        Replaces the namespace delimiter in term with a string that is safe for inference, and for all common file systems.

      • toSafeNamespaceDelimiter

        public static java.lang.String toSafeNamespaceDelimiter(java.lang.String kbHref,
                                                        java.lang.String term)
        Replaces the namespace delimiter in term with a string that is safe for inference and for all common file systems, but only if kbHref is an empty string or == null. If kbHref is not empty, term is probably being prepared for display in the Sigma Browser and does not have to be converted to a "safe" form.

      • w3cToKif

        public static java.lang.String w3cToKif(java.lang.String term)

      • kifToW3c

        public static java.lang.String kifToW3c(java.lang.String term)

        public static boolean quoted(java.lang.String input)

      • quote

        public static java.lang.String quote(java.lang.String input)

      • unquote

        public static java.lang.String unquote(java.lang.String input)

      • isLocalTermReference

        public static boolean isLocalTermReference(java.lang.String term)

      • getLocalReferenceBaseName

        public static java.lang.String getLocalReferenceBaseName()

      • setLocalReferenceBaseName

        public static void setLocalReferenceBaseName(java.lang.String basename)

      • renameFileIfExists

        public static java.io.File renameFileIfExists(java.io.File f)
        If the file f already exists, this method returns a new File object with a unique name formed by appending an integer. If the filename has a file type suffix, the integer is inserted between the base name and the suffix. If f does not exist, it is simply returned.
        Parameters:
        f - A File
        Returns:
        A File with a name different from f's name, if f exists, else f.

      • wordWrap

        public static java.lang.String wordWrap(java.lang.String input,
                                        int length)

      • wordWrap

        public static java.lang.String wordWrap(java.lang.String input)
        Convenience method with default line length of 70

      • integerToPaddedString

        public static java.lang.String integerToPaddedString(int intval)
        Returns:
        a string version of the integer padded with 0's to a length of 8

      • stringToKIF

        public static java.lang.String stringToKIF(java.lang.String input,
                                           boolean upcaseFirst)
        Convert any arbitrary string to a valid KIF id. There is no guarantee that it is unique however, since the current KB isn't inspected.

      • indent

        public static java.lang.String indent(int num,
                                      java.lang.String indentChars)

      • findBalancedParen

        public static int findBalancedParen(int pIndex,
                                    java.lang.String st)
        Find the parenthesis that balances the one in st at character pIndex
        Returns:
        -1 if not found

      • fillString

        public static java.lang.String fillString(java.lang.String st,
                                          char fillchar,
                                          int totalLength,
                                          boolean prepend)
        Fill a string with the desired character up to the totalLength. If string is null return a completely filled string.

      • getContents

        public static java.lang.String getContents(java.io.File aFile)
        Fetch the entire contents of a text file, and return it in a String. This style of implementation does not throw Exceptions to the caller.
        Parameters:
        aFile - is a file which already exists and can be read.
